intro: Taraxacum ranunculus, commonly known as the lesser hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and a yellow flower head composed of numerous small florets. The plant produces a milky sap that contains various compounds, some of which have been studied for their potential medicinal properties. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and typically grows in meadows and grassy areas. The species is often mistaken for other dandelion-like plants due to its similar appearance.
